intro: Weinmannia mammea, commonly known as the velvetleaf tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a large evergreen tree that can grow up to 30 meters tall, characterized by its broad, palmate leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in panicles, followed by woody, egg-shaped fruits that contain a single seed. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts. The tree is also valued for its ornamental qualities and its ability to thrive in diverse environmental conditions.
